changes.diff:
Line 449: Line 449:
Rama married actress [[:sq:Matilda Makoçi|Matilda Makoçi]]. The couple divorced in 1991. Rama has a son from his first marriage, Gregor, who is a cancer survivor.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gazeta-shqip.com/lajme/2013/05/19/rrefimi-dramatik-i-gregut-biseda-me-edin-kur-u-diagnostikova-me-kancer/|title=Rrëfimi dramatik i Gregut: Biseda me Edin kur u diagnostikova me kancer|website=Gazeta Shqiptare|language=sq|date=19 May 2013|access-date=30 December 2018}}</ref> Rama's daughter-in-law was one of the 51 fatalities in the [[2019 Albania earthquake]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/28/europe/albania-earthquake-prime-minister-daughter-in-law-intl/index.html|title=Albanian Prime Minister's future daughter-in-law among dozens dead in earthquake|author=Rob Picheta|website=CNN|date=28 November 2019}}</ref> Since 2010, Rama has been married to [[Linda Rama]] (née Basha), an economist and civil society activist.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.arkivalajmeve.com/Lidhjet-dashurore-te-Edi-Rames-nga-Makoci-tek-Basha.1046943615/ |title=Lidhjet dashurore te Edi Rames nga Makoci tek Basha – Arkiva Shqiptare e Lajmeve |website=arkivalajmeve.com |access-date=25 June 2017 |archive-date=3 September 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170903032946/http://www.arkivalajmeve.com/Lidhjet-dashurore-te-Edi-Rames-nga-Makoci-tek-Basha.1046943615/ |url-status=dead }}</ref> Mrs. Rama is a graduate of the University of Tirana and holds a Master of Arts in Economy and is a Doctor of Sciences in Economy. Until 1998 she has worked in high levels of public administration including the Head of the National Privatization Agency. She has a long academic experience as a lecturer in International Finance at the University of Tirana and a lecturer of Public Policies in the European University of Tirana. She is the author of several scientific researches and publications in her field. Together they have a son, Zaho,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.oranews.tv/vendi/vjen-ne-jete-femija-kryeministror/|title=Oranews.tv – Mirëserdhe Zaho! Lind djali i çiftit kryeministror Edi dhe Linda Rama. Fotoja e përqafimit atëror|website=Oranews|access-date=25 June 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170903035040/http://www.oranews.tv/vendi/vjen-ne-jete-femija-kryeministror/|archive-date=3 September 2017|url-status=dead}}</ref> born in 2014.
Rama married actress [[:sq:Matilda Makoçi|Matilda Makoçi]]. The couple divorced in 1991. Rama has a son from his first marriage, Gregor, who is a cancer survivor.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://gazeta-shqip.com/lajme/2013/05/19/rrefimi-dramatik-i-gregut-biseda-me-edin-kur-u-diagnostikova-me-kancer/|title=Rrëfimi dramatik i Gregut: Biseda me Edin kur u diagnostikova me kancer|website=Gazeta Shqiptare|language=sq|date=19 May 2013|access-date=30 December 2018}}</ref> Rama's daughter-in-law was one of the 51 fatalities in the [[2019 Albania earthquake]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/28/europe/albania-earthquake-prime-minister-daughter-in-law-intl/index.html|title=Albanian Prime Minister's future daughter-in-law among dozens dead in earthquake|author=Rob Picheta|website=CNN|date=28 November 2019}}</ref> Since 2010, Rama has been married to [[Linda Rama]] (née Basha), an economist and civil society activist.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.arkivalajmeve.com/Lidhjet-dashurore-te-Edi-Rames-nga-Makoci-tek-Basha.1046943615/ |title=Lidhjet dashurore te Edi Rames nga Makoci tek Basha – Arkiva Shqiptare e Lajmeve |website=arkivalajmeve.com |access-date=25 June 2017 |archive-date=3 September 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170903032946/http://www.arkivalajmeve.com/Lidhjet-dashurore-te-Edi-Rames-nga-Makoci-tek-Basha.1046943615/ |url-status=dead }}</ref> Mrs. Rama is a graduate of the University of Tirana and holds a Master of Arts in Economy and is a Doctor of Sciences in Economy. Until 1998 she has worked in high levels of public administration including the Head of the National Privatization Agency. She has a long academic experience as a lecturer in International Finance at the University of Tirana and a lecturer of Public Policies in the European University of Tirana. She is the author of several scientific researches and publications in her field. Together they have a son, Zaho,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.oranews.tv/vendi/vjen-ne-jete-femija-kryeministror/|title=Oranews.tv – Mirëserdhe Zaho! Lind djali i çiftit kryeministror Edi dhe Linda Rama. Fotoja e përqafimit atëror|website=Oranews|access-date=25 June 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170903035040/http://www.oranews.tv/vendi/vjen-ne-jete-femija-kryeministror/|archive-date=3 September 2017|url-status=dead}}</ref> born in 2014.


Aside from his native [[Albanian language|Albanian]], Rama is fluent in [[English language|English]], [[French language|French]], and [[Italian language|Italian]].<ref> https://www.ekathimerini.com/news/34493/edi-rama-from-art-school-to-city-hall/</ref><ref> https://032c.com/magazine/albanian-prime-minister-edi-ramas-surrealist-bureaucracy</ref><ref> https://www.kryeministria.al/en/newsroom/kryeministri-edi-rama-ne-bergamo-itali-ne-interviste-per-drejtorin-e-skytg-24-giuseppe-de-bellis/</ref>
Aside from his native [[Albanian language|Albanian]], Rama is fluent in [[English language|English]], [[French language|French]], and [[Italian language|Italian]].<ref> https://www.ekathimerini.com/news/34493/edi-rama-from-art-school-to-city-hall/</ref><ref>{{cite web | title=Albanian Prime Minister EDI RAMA's Surrealist Bureaucracy | 032c | date=3 February 2014 | url=https://032c.com/magazine/albanian-prime-minister-edi-ramas-surrealist-bureaucracy }}</ref><ref> https://www.kryeministria.al/en/newsroom/kryeministri-edi-rama-ne-bergamo-itali-ne-interviste-per-drejtorin-e-skytg-24-giuseppe-de-bellis/</ref>


Rama is a supporter of the sports teams [[FK Partizani Tirana|FK Partizani]] and [[Juventus FC|Juventus]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://periskopi.com/edi-rama-si-tifoz-flaket-juventusit-keshtu-po-e-pret-finalen-foto/|title=Edi Rama si tifoz i flakët i Juventusit, kështu po e pret finalen (Foto)|publisher=Periskopi.com|language=sq|date=3 June 2017|access-date=30 December 2018}}</ref> His younger brother, Olsi Rama, is the sporting director of Partizani Tirana.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://shqiptarja.com/lajm/olsi-rama-zyrtarisht-drejtor-br-i-partizanit-gati-prezantimi-br?r=pop5s|title=Olsi Rama zyrtarisht drejtor i Partizanit, gati prezantimi|trans-title=Olsi Rama officially sporting director of Partizai, the presentation is ready|publisher=Shqiptarja.com|language=sq|date=11 December 2017|access-date=30 December 2018}}</ref>
Rama is a supporter of the sports teams [[FK Partizani Tirana|FK Partizani]] and [[Juventus FC|Juventus]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://periskopi.com/edi-rama-si-tifoz-flaket-juventusit-keshtu-po-e-pret-finalen-foto/|title=Edi Rama si tifoz i flakët i Juventusit, kështu po e pret finalen (Foto)|publisher=Periskopi.com|language=sq|date=3 June 2017|access-date=30 December 2018}}</ref> His younger brother, Olsi Rama, is the sporting director of Partizani Tirana.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://shqiptarja.com/lajm/olsi-rama-zyrtarisht-drejtor-br-i-partizanit-gati-prezantimi-br?r=pop5s|title=Olsi Rama zyrtarisht drejtor i Partizanit, gati prezantimi|trans-title=Olsi Rama officially sporting director of Partizai, the presentation is ready|publisher=Shqiptarja.com|language=sq|date=11 December 2017|access-date=30 December 2018}}</ref>

===Other===
===Other===
Prime Minister Rama received the CAM Global Leadership Award for his work in fighting antisemitism and other types of religious prejudice.<ref>{{cite news |date= 28 September 2024|title= Combat Antisemitism Movement honors Albanian prime minister for combating hate|url= https://www.jpost.com/diaspora/article-822118|work= Jerusalem Post |access-date=30 September 2024}}</ref>
Prime Minister Rama received the Global Leadership Award of pro-Israel NGO [[Combat Antisemitism Movement]] for his work in fighting antisemitism and other types of religious prejudice.<ref>{{cite news |date= 28 September 2024|title= Combat Antisemitism Movement honors Albanian prime minister for combating hate|url= https://www.jpost.com/diaspora/article-822118|work= Jerusalem Post |access-date=30 September 2024}}</ref>

{{Edi Rama series}}
{{Edi Rama series}}
'''Edvin Kristaq Rama''' (born 4 July 1964) is an Albanian politician, artist and writer who has been serving as the 33rd and incumbent [[prime minister of Albania]] since 2013 and chairman of the [[Socialist Party of Albania]] since 2005. He was [[Ministry of Culture (Albania)|Minister of Culture, Youth and Sports]] from 1998 to 2000. First elected [[mayor of Tirana]] in 2000, he was reelected in 2003 and 2007.
'''Edvin Rama''' (born 4 July 1964) is an Albanian politician, artist and writer who has been serving as the 33rd and incumbent [[prime minister of Albania]] since 2013 and chairman of the [[Socialist Party of Albania]] since 2005. He was [[Ministry of Culture (Albania)|Minister of Culture, Youth and Sports]] from 1998 to 2000. First elected [[mayor of Tirana]] in 2000, he was reelected in 2003 and 2007.


The coalition of centre-left parties led by Rama in the [[2013 Albanian parliamentary election]] defeated the incumbent centre-right coalition led by [[Sali Berisha]] of the [[Democratic Party of Albania]]. Rama was appointed prime minister for a second term following the [[2017 Albanian parliamentary election]]. Rama then won a third term following the [[2021 Albanian parliamentary election]] in which he defeated the Democratic Party candidate [[Lulzim Basha]] for the second time in a row.
The coalition of centre-left parties led by Rama in the [[2013 Albanian parliamentary election]] defeated the incumbent centre-right coalition led by [[Sali Berisha]] of the [[Democratic Party of Albania]]. Rama was appointed prime minister for a second term following the [[2017 Albanian parliamentary election]]. Rama then won a third term following the [[2021 Albanian parliamentary election]] in which he defeated the Democratic Party candidate [[Lulzim Basha]] for the second time in a row.

changes.diff:
Line 142: Line 142:
Rama and [[Ramush Haradinaj]], then [[Prime Minister of Kosovo]], had a clash in late 2019 due to different views on the [[Open Balkan]] initiative. Rama stated that Haradinaj "lies due to ignorance or on purpose".<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://emerging-europe.com/news/mini-schengen-risks-driving-a-wedge-between-albania-and-kosovo/|title='Mini-Schengen' risks driving a wedge between Albania and Kosovo|date=23 December 2019|website=Emerging Europe|access-date=23 January 2021}}</ref> In 2020 Rama filed a lawsuit for defamation against Haradinaj.<ref>{{cite web| url = https://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2020-01-16/albanian-pm-sues-kosovos-haradinaj-for-defamation-over-land-swap-claims| url-status = dead| archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20200117173503/https://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2020-01-16/albanian-pm-sues-kosovos-haradinaj-for-defamation-over-land-swap-claims| archive-date = 17 January 2020| title = Albanian PM Sues Kosovo's Haradinaj for Defamation Over Land-Swap Claims {{!}} World News {{!}} US News}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.slobodnaevropa.org/a/haradinaj-i-rama-na-sudu/30380720.html|title=Haradinaj i Rama na sudu|website=Radio Slobodna Evropa|date=16 January 2020 |language=sh|access-date=23 January 2021 |last1=Loxha |first1=Amra Zejneli }}</ref>
Rama and [[Ramush Haradinaj]], then [[Prime Minister of Kosovo]], had a clash in late 2019 due to different views on the [[Open Balkan]] initiative. Rama stated that Haradinaj "lies due to ignorance or on purpose".<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://emerging-europe.com/news/mini-schengen-risks-driving-a-wedge-between-albania-and-kosovo/|title='Mini-Schengen' risks driving a wedge between Albania and Kosovo|date=23 December 2019|website=Emerging Europe|access-date=23 January 2021}}</ref> In 2020 Rama filed a lawsuit for defamation against Haradinaj.<ref>{{cite web| url = https://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2020-01-16/albanian-pm-sues-kosovos-haradinaj-for-defamation-over-land-swap-claims| url-status = dead| archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20200117173503/https://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2020-01-16/albanian-pm-sues-kosovos-haradinaj-for-defamation-over-land-swap-claims| archive-date = 17 January 2020| title = Albanian PM Sues Kosovo's Haradinaj for Defamation Over Land-Swap Claims {{!}} World News {{!}} US News}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.slobodnaevropa.org/a/haradinaj-i-rama-na-sudu/30380720.html|title=Haradinaj i Rama na sudu|website=Radio Slobodna Evropa|date=16 January 2020 |language=sh|access-date=23 January 2021 |last1=Loxha |first1=Amra Zejneli }}</ref>


In 2023, the minimum wage was increased to 40,000ALL (€404) per month, an increase from that of 24,000ALL in 2017. <ref>{{Cite web |title=Albania |url=https://wageindicator.org/salary/minimum-wage/albania |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240706225233/https://wageindicator.org/salary/minimum-wage/albania |archive-date=6 July 2024 |access-date=10 May 2025 |website=WageIndicator Foundation |language=en |url-status=live }}</ref> Throughout 2024 and 2025, Rama’s government increased wages in the public administration, with the average gross salary in the public administration reaching €1040. <ref>{{Cite web |title=Further Increase Salaries in Public Sector; Gov't |url=https://albaniandailynews.com/news/further-increase-salaries-in-public-sector-gov-t |access-date=10 May 2025 |website=ALBANIA DAILY NEWS |language=en}}</ref>
In 2023, the minimum wage was increased to 40,000ALL (€404) per month, an increase from that of 24,000ALL in 2017.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Albania |url=https://wageindicator.org/salary/minimum-wage/albania |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240706225233/https://wageindicator.org/salary/minimum-wage/albania |archive-date=6 July 2024 |access-date=10 May 2025 |website=WageIndicator Foundation |language=en |url-status=live }}</ref> Throughout 2024 and 2025, Rama’s government increased wages in the public administration, with the average gross salary in the public administration reaching €1040.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Further Increase Salaries in Public Sector; Gov't |url=https://albaniandailynews.com/news/further-increase-salaries-in-public-sector-gov-t |access-date=10 May 2025 |website=ALBANIA DAILY NEWS |language=en}}</ref>


In 2024, Rama announced plans to create a new [[European microstate]] called the [[Sovereign State of the Bektashi Order]] enclaved within [[Tirana]]. The new country is planned to serve as the headquarters of the [[Bektashi Order]], a [[Sufism|Sufi]] Islamic order led by [[Baba Mondi]].<ref name=":3">{{Cite news |last=Higgens |first=Andrew |date=21 September 2024 |title=Albania Is Planning a New Muslim State Inside Its Capital |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2024/09/21/world/europe/albania-tirana-muslim-state-bektashi.html |url-status=live |access-date=21 September 2024 |work=[[The New York Times]] |archive-date=21 September 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240921090757/https://www.nytimes.com/2024/09/21/world/europe/albania-tirana-muslim-state-bektashi.html }}</ref>
In 2024, Rama announced plans to create a new [[European microstate]] called the [[Sovereign State of the Bektashi Order]] enclaved within [[Tirana]]. The new country is planned to serve as the headquarters of the [[Bektashi Order]], a [[Sufism|Sufi]] Islamic order led by [[Baba Mondi]].<ref name=":3">{{Cite news |last=Higgens |first=Andrew |date=21 September 2024 |title=Albania Is Planning a New Muslim State Inside Its Capital |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2024/09/21/world/europe/albania-tirana-muslim-state-bektashi.html |url-status=live |access-date=21 September 2024 |work=[[The New York Times]] |archive-date=21 September 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240921090757/https://www.nytimes.com/2024/09/21/world/europe/albania-tirana-muslim-state-bektashi.html }}</ref>

changes.diff:
Line 83: Line 83:
The coalition of centre-left parties led by Rama in the [[2013 Albanian parliamentary election]] defeated the incumbent centre-right coalition led by [[Sali Berisha]] of the [[Democratic Party of Albania]]. Rama was appointed prime minister for a second term following the [[2017 Albanian parliamentary election]]. Rama then won a third term following the [[2021 Albanian parliamentary election]] in which he defeated the Democratic Party candidate [[Lulzim Basha]] for the second time in a row.
The coalition of centre-left parties led by Rama in the [[2013 Albanian parliamentary election]] defeated the incumbent centre-right coalition led by [[Sali Berisha]] of the [[Democratic Party of Albania]]. Rama was appointed prime minister for a second term following the [[2017 Albanian parliamentary election]]. Rama then won a third term following the [[2021 Albanian parliamentary election]] in which he defeated the Democratic Party candidate [[Lulzim Basha]] for the second time in a row.


Rama is the only Albanian prime minister in history to have won four terms in a row. His party has won all seven elections since 2013—four parliamentary ones and three local ones. Under his decade of tenure, Albania has seen economic growth but also [[democratic backsliding]], with various sources describing his rule as [[Autocracy|autocratic]].<ref name = Mayr>{{Cite news |last=Mayr |first=Walter |date=20 September 2024 |title=A Blind Eye?: Albanian Leader Rama a Darling of Europe Despite Corruption Back Home |url=https://www.spiegel.de/international/europe/a-blind-eye-albanian-leader-rama-a-darling-of-europe-despite-corruption-back-home-a-616a6ee1-f4bb-4ec9-8669-4e1ffd42ae00 |access-date=8 December 2024 |work=Der Spiegel |language=en |issn=2195-1349}}</ref> Albania has also continued to suffer from [[Albanian diaspora|emigration]].
Rama is the only Albanian prime minister in history to have won four terms in a row. His party has won all seven elections since 2013—four parliamentary ones and three local ones. Under his decade of tenure, Albania has seen economic growth but also [[democratic backsliding]], with various sources describing his rule as [[Autocracy|autocratic]].<ref name = Mayr>{{Cite news |last=Mayr |first=Walter |date=20 September 2024 |title=A Blind Eye?: Albanian Leader Rama a Darling of Europe Despite Corruption Back Home |url=https://www.spiegel.de/international/europe/a-blind-eye-albanian-leader-rama-a-darling-of-europe-despite-corruption-back-home-a-616a6ee1-f4bb-4ec9-8669-4e1ffd42ae00 |access-date=8 December 2024 |work=Der Spiegel |language=en |issn=2195-1349}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal |last=Myftari |first=J. |year=2024 |title=Fading freedoms: democratic decline in Albania |journal=Democratization |volume=32 |issue=2 |pages=495–512 |doi=10.1080/13510347.2024.2377340}}</ref> Albania has also continued to suffer from [[Albanian diaspora|emigration]].


Rama was one of the initiators of [[Open Balkan]], an economic zone of the Western Balkan countries intended to guarantee the "[[Four freedoms (European Union)|Four Freedoms]]".
Rama was one of the initiators of [[Open Balkan]], an economic zone of the Western Balkan countries intended to guarantee the "[[Four freedoms (European Union)|Four Freedoms]]".

summary.reason: Added a new academic reference discussing democratic decline in Albania under Rama's rule.

Rama is a supporter of the sports teams [[FK Partizani Tirana|FK Partizani]] and [[Juventus FC|Juventus]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://periskopi.com/edi-rama-si-tifoz-flaket-juventusit-keshtu-po-e-pret-finalen-foto/|title=Edi Rama si tifoz i flakët i Juventusit, kështu po e pret finalen (Foto)|publisher=Periskopi.com|language=sq|date=3 June 2017|access-date=30 December 2018}}</ref> His younger brother, Olsi Rama, is the sporting director of Partizani Tirana.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://shqiptarja.com/lajm/olsi-rama-zyrtarisht-drejtor-br-i-partizanit-gati-prezantimi-br?r=pop5s|title=Olsi Rama zyrtarisht drejtor i Partizanit, gati prezantimi|trans-title=Olsi Rama officially sporting director of Partizai, the presentation is ready|publisher=Shqiptarja.com|language=sq|date=11 December 2017|access-date=30 December 2018}}</ref>
